member.name: ID3D12DescriptorHeap.GetCPUDescriptorHandleForHeapStart
member.summary: Gets the CPU descriptor handle that represents the start of the heap.
member.returns: Returns the CPU descriptor handle that represents the start of the heap.

member.name: ID3D12DescriptorHeap.GetDesc
member.returns: The description of the descriptor heap, as a structure.

member.name: ID3D12DescriptorHeap.GetGPUDescriptorHandleForHeapStart
member.summary: Gets the GPU descriptor handle that represents the start of the heap.
member.returns: Returns the GPU descriptor handle that represents the start of the heap. If the descriptor heap is not shader-visible, a null handle is returned.

member.name: ID3D12DescriptorHeap
member.summary: A descriptor heap is a collection of contiguous allocations of descriptors, one allocation for every descriptor. Descriptor heaps contain many object types that are not part of a Pipeline State Object (PSO), such as Shader Resource Views (SRVs), Unordered Access Views (UAVs), Constant Buffer Views (CBVs), and Samplers.
